events.name: I/O Extended 2015 - Munich
events.description: We are quite full, but if you appear on time you might be lucky to catch a seat! Please confirm if you plan to join us: https://plus.google.com/events/cvv3ka4psrhkva1cooabhe5fj0k

events.name: GDG Munich Meetup
events.description:
Dear devs and tech-friends,

time passes so fast and it's now more than 2 months since our last event, the IO Extended 2015. We now managed to organize the next meetup with 3 interesting talks:

1) Continuus Deployment with Docker (Yuriy Susuk)

2) Adwords Script (Marcus Stade)

3) Google Tag Manager (Marcus Stade)

Of course we will not let you stay hungry and thirsty. Our host was so friendly to offer us again the location and the food sponsoring! Our special thanks therefore go to Eugene and Jetbrains GmbH!

See you soon!
Albert, Angelo, Markus & Jonas

P.S. If you have some interesting talk for our next sessions, please don't hesitate to fill out our speaker-form: http://goo.gl/forms/HX3mF8sJVi﻿. Currently looking for the topics SEO and open source CMS.

events.name: GDG DevFest Munich 2015
events.description:
Dear Munich dev community!

we are proud to announce that the GDGs in Munich will also host a dev-fest this year in town! We will have some high-rated international talks,  demos and hands-on sessions about current topics, mainly in the VR, cloud and Android sector!

Here already some of the highlights:

Alex Osterloh (topic: BigData, Cloud) - ca 1 hour with questions
Noah Falstein (topic: VR, Tango) - min. 1 hour with questions
Beacons Demo - ca. 1 hour
AI talk by Neokami CTO + Demo, ca. 20-30 min.
(more to follow)

GDG Android Munich
GDG Munich
GDG Munich Go-Lang﻿

events.name: Make Munich 2016
events.description:
Make Munich is South Germany‘s biggest maker and do-it-yourself festival. At the two-day event innovative, ecologically aware, technology-loving makers will show off their culture and technology at booths, in talks, and during handson workshops. The 2016 motto is „Just MAKE it“.

The Maker Festival consists of 2 days of exhibitions, workshops, project presentations, talks and a community party.

Talks: http://make-munich.de/talks-vortragsbuehne/

Presentations: http://make-munich.de/talks-praesentationsbuehne/

Workshops: http://make-munich.de/workshops-2/

Robo Cup: http://make-munich.de/robocup/

Tickets: http://make-munich.de/about/tickets/


GDG Special: IoT Talk and Workshop at the Make Munich

Sascha Wolter, Google Developer Expert for IoT, is giving a talk and a workshop about the Physical Web at MakeMunich!

Saschas talk starts on the 16th of January at 2.50pm, followed by the workshop at 3.15pm. At the latter you have the chance to learn/ try out the basics of the Eddystone Beacons. Requirements for the Workshop are: basic knowledge in coding for Android, own Laptop with Android Studio, Android Developer Device (min. 5.x).

In case you want to meet the GDG Organizers at the Make Munich just give us a call or Whatsapp via [masked] (Albert, only Saturday)

The event is hosted by

Make Germany GmbH
Moselstr. 10
81677 München

Represented by
Martin Laarmann
events.how_to_find_us: Linie U6 Richtung Garching-Forschungszentrum. Vom U-Bahnhof Freimann (U6) laufen Sie ca 700m Richtung Westen über die Edmund-Rumpler-Str. zum Zenith (Lilienthalallee 29).

events.name: GDG Munich & Women Techmakers Meetup
events.description:
Dear folks,

we are proud to announce the first joint meetup that we perform with WTM (Women Techmakers) in a new collaboration between the two groups! Annette Leonhard MacDonald is now part of the GDG orga team and brings us a new quality of audience!

This meetup is a special type of event, almost like the DevFest. It will be held shortly before the international womens day on March 8th and will not only feature tech-talks, but this time also an IoT workshop centered around the Intel Edison. The other topics are:

- Security
- Mainframes

This is the Agenda:

13:30 Entry open
13:45 Official event kick-off
14:00 Talk 1: Nicoleta Mihali & Julia Jauß - IoT use case with Project Oxford (face & speach recognition)
14:50 Sandwich Break
15:00 Talk 2: Dr. Hosnieh (Sara) Rafiee - SDN/NFV Security Status
15:30 IOT WORKSHOP: Sulamita Garcia  - Intel Edison Workshop
17:00 Talk 3: Wolfgang Stief - Special challenges when collecting historical mainframes (Multimedia-Show)
17:50 Break
18:00 Talk 4: Patrick Ben Koetter - Status Report on DNSSec, DANE, SMIMEA and Open PGP Keys
18:45 Pizza & Socializing & Open End

Microsoft was so friendly to provide us with the location and organic fuel for our bodies and brain cells. We'll have space for about 50 people.

Looking forward to seeing you in March!

Albert, Marcus, Angelo & Annette
events.how_to_find_us: With the map app of your choice

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2016 Munich
events.description:
Dear devs,

just like last year we the GDG Munich organizes again a big I/O Extended event- this time however, in the new Google office that was inaugurated today!

There are 150 places available which should be enough for everyone. Last year we had about 130 guests btw. Please come by public transportation, bicycle or scooter if possible.

See you soon!

GDG Munich & WTM Orga Team

Albert
Marcus
Angelo
Alexander
& Annette

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2016 Munich - Extra Seats
events.description:
Extra seats for those who volunteer to participate as a speaker in our next meetups this year or who give us a sponsoring donation. If you want to offer to purchase some food or t-shirts for the attendees, let us know via e-mail: [masked]

Speaker signup form: http://goo.gl/forms/Lfdi3SLHBe

FYI: only previously confirmed (separate e-mail) group members are allowed to RSVP here.

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2016 Munich - VIP Seats
events.description:
Hey folks!

I came up with the idea to provide 10 dedicated VIP seats in the first or second row for people who did not manage to reserve a spot in time and would like to contribute via sponsoring - which we need to cover our costs (Meetup fee, food, drinks). As we are independent from Google we do not get any funding from them, besides the highly appreciated swag that will be there also this time!

Therefore your contribution would be highly appreciated!
Albert

events.name: Course - Google Cloud Platform Fundamentals
events.description:
The GDG Munich, Google and Loodse invite you to this hands-on class to help introduce you to Google's Cloud Platform.

Course Description

This 8 hour instructor-led class introduces participants to Google Cloud Platform products and services. Through a combination of instructor-led presentations, demonstrations, and hands-on labs, students learn the value of Google Cloud Platform and how to incorporate cloud-based solutions into business strategies.

Language

This class will be taught in GERMAN.

Audience 

This class is intended for: Systems Operations professionals, Solution Developers, and Solutions Architects using Google Cloud Platform to create or migrate applications and application environmentsBusiness leaders who are evaluating cloud solutions or are new to Google Cloud Platform Prerequisites Before attending this course, participants should have: Basic proficiency with command-line tools Familiarity with one or more programming languages such as Java or Python

What to bring

For this class, please bring:

•  Laptop (Windows, Mac OS or Linux)

• Credit Card - you won't be billed but this is needed to sign up for the free trial

• Photo ID - needed for security

events.name: GDG Munich January Meetup: Firebase!
events.description:
Happy new Year Everyone! The first meetup this year will be all about Firebase!
We would be very happy to have you or someone you know share your knowledge and experience. Please submit your proposals for (lightning) Talks using this cfp: https://goo.gl/forms/SjsxtPA3tja7jojZ2

This will be the agenda so far:

19:00 Doors open, hang out with drinks and pizza
19:30 Nick Skelton: Push Notifications
20:00 Juhani Lehtimäki: Firebase gotchas and tips on mobile (Android) development.
20:20 Enrique López Mañas: Firebase Security and Authentication

Once the topics are decided the Schedule will be Updated

See you soon!

events.name: GDG Munich February Meetup: Machine Learning
events.description:
This time lets focus on Machine Learning Topics.

Of course there will be Pizza and Drinks for everyone thanks to our Sponsor.

The Agenda Will be:

19:00 - Welcome
19:10 - Seeing like a Machine - more than just a summer project by Stanislav Frolov

21:30 - Thanks and Goodbye

events.name: I/O Extended 2018 Munich
events.description:
It's Time for Google I/O 2018!
Like every Year we will watch the Keynote together and of course there will be food and drinks.

Agenda:

18:00 : Door Opening
19:00 - 20:30 : Keynote Livestream
20:30 - 21:00: Break
21:00 - 21:30: "Android Automotive: Bringing Android to Cars" by Chris Carde (founding member of the Android Auto team)
21:30 - 21:45: Break
21:45 - 22:45 : Developer Keynote Livestream

As we have limited space please remember to cancel if you cannot make it so people on the waitlist can get a chance for a spot!

events.name: Flutter Study Jam (1/3)
events.description:
Flutter Study Jams are Community-run study groups based on the Flutter Udacity Course. Participants learn how to use Flutter to develop high-quality, interactive mobile applications for iOS and Android devices.

Study Jams are a great opportunity to bring members of your community together to learn Flutter in person and support them to complete the course. Everyone, who completes the course will get a Google-offered Study Jam completion certificate and a profile badge.

WHO?
Flutter Study Jam is suited best for: 1) those just getting started with mobile app development 2) those with programming experience on other mobile app frameworks.

The Study Jam in total takes 7 Hours therefore the Event is split into 3 Days. Please also signup to the follow up events if you want to experience the whole journey:

Event 2: https://www.meetup.com/de-DE/gdg-munich/events/254172899/
Event 3: https://www.meetup.com/de-DE/gdg-munich/events/254172905/

As space is limited make sure to cancel your Seat if you cannot make it to give others a chance

events.description:

Flutter Study Jams are Community-run study groups based on the Flutter Udacity Course. Participants learn how to use Flutter to develop high-quality, interactive mobile applications for iOS and Android devices.

Study Jams are a great opportunity to bring members of your community together to learn Flutter in person and support them to complete the course. Everyone, who completes the course will get a Google-offered Study Jam completion certificate and a profile badge.

WHO?
Flutter Study Jam is suited best for: 1) those just getting started with mobile app development 2) those with programming experience on other mobile app frameworks.

events.name: DACHFest 2018 (DevFest DACH)
events.description:
For this year's DevFest season, GDG and WTM communities of Germany, Austria, and Switzerland are all working together to organize our largest event yet: DACHFest!

DACHFest is a two-day DevFest conference focused on making a difference. Meet technology experts, discover all the different ways in which emerging technology is transforming lives, find out how to make your apps and websites friendly towards everyone, learn the secrets of building and nurturing a diverse community — let our speakers surprise and inspire you! And don't forget to make new friends: there will be plenty of opportunities to meet people passionate about your favorite things. ❤️

Join us in Munich on November 10–11 for two days full of talks, workshops, showcases, networking, and fun!

DACHFest is a paid event, but diversity scholarships are available for people who belong to underrepresented groups in tech or cannot afford a ticket.

Website: https://dachfest.com
Twitter: https://twitter.com/dachfest
Call for papers (until September 15): http://papercall.io/dachfest18

events.name: February meetup!
events.description:
Hello everybody,
it’s time for our first meetup in 2019! ^^

Let’s meet for a drink and discuss the latest news, our plans or goals for this year and the rest of winter time =)

We would also love to hear from you what kind of topics keep your interest at the moment, so that we can try to organise some talks about it.

See you soon everyone!

events.name: European Cyber Security Month
events.description:
October is a great month for many things and we want to make sure that cyber security is one of them!

ECSM [1] is the EU’s annual awareness campaign that takes place each October across Europe. The aim is to raise awareness of cyber security threats, promote cyber security among citizens and organizations; and provide resources to protect themselves online, through education and sharing of good practices.

We are glad to have the Google Safety Engineering Center in Munich [2] contributing to this cause and willing to share their expertise with us.

Join us!

Agenda

Talk 1: Data Retention in Practice
by Stefan Toman

Building products that put privacy and security first and handle user data with profound respect is essential to earn user trust. In this talk we will discuss how to collect and how long to store user data to be respectful to the users and comply with applicable rules. We will present some best practices, tips, and tools that we use at Google on a daily basis.

Talk 2: Building Privacy for the User
by André Lago

Building efficient privacy tools is essential in order to meet the user's expectations and provide them with control over their data. Because of this, it's extremely important to design privacy products in a way that fulfills the needs of the users and provides them positive value. In this talk we'll go through the history behind some of Google's main privacy products, describing some of the processes through which we design and develop them.

Speakers:

André Lago
André is a Software Engineer working on some of Google's User-Facing Privacy products. By working on these products over the past year, André became passionate about how to design products that meet user's needs and constantly growing expectations.

Stefan Toman
Stefan is a Software Engineer at Google's Privacy and Data Protection Office in Munich. He works on tools and infrastructure for user consents that are used in most Google products. He deeply cares that users always have a fair choice on how their data is collected or used and that those choices are respected. Before joining Google Stefan had a slide from his office in the university's mathematics department to the cafeteria and he is delighted that Google offers similar facilities in Zurich.

Be cool:
As we have limited space please remember to cancel if you cannot make it so that people on the waiting list can get a chance for a spot!

[1] https://cybersecuritymonth.eu/
[2] https://about.google/google-safety-engineering-center/
